result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan N Portillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  Restitution in amount of $2,750.00 payable to Konta S.  Joint and several with Donnell Johnson 15CF2143 and Derrel Taylor 15CF2145.  All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-All applicable fees of supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence/count.  Credit for 300 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs.
No contact with Konta S. or codefendants Donnell Johnson and Derrel Taylor.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for 300 days.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence/count.  Credit for 300 days.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after two  (2) years confinement.

cf
Due date/costs based on this case and 14CF3262

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Wanda R.  Exhibits 1-7 received.  Exhibit list received and filed.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 9 YEARS with 300 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 300 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 5:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 300 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 2 years confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Konta S or co-defendants Donnell Johnson & Derrel Taylor
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,750 payable to Konta S JOINT AND SEVERAL with Donnell Johnson (case# 15CF2143) & Derrel Taylor (case# 15CF2145); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Branch 22 agrees to take sentencing for global resolution.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Jonathan N Portillo not in court, in custody.  Dennis Stingl for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 35.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
If defendant enters a plea in case# 14CF3066 & 14CF3262 Court will acccept this case for global resolution in Branch 22 on 02/25/2016 at 8:30am.
- filed.  Court ordered charge in COUNT 3 amended to THEFT FROM PERSON OR CORPSE- PARTY TO A CRIME, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), a Class G Felony.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  State files amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waives formal reading.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to Counts 3, 4 and 5 of the amended information.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalties.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Jonathan N Portillo not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is currently in trial and unable to begin conducting this trial until tomorrow.  Court orders matter adjourned.  Trial to proceed tomorrow at 9am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter has been joined for trial with #15CF2143.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter continues on the record.  Court hears argument re: trial issues.  For reasons as stated on the record, Court will allow State to amend information.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/1/16 at 9:30am in br. 35.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court (by phone), defendant Jonathan N Portillo not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court and defense counsel are currently in trial on other matters.  Court orders final pretrial date adjourned.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/1/16 at 9:30am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, filed.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on State's motion for joinder with #15CF2143 and pending drug matters and Attorney Kovac's motion for severance.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter is called on the record.  Court hears argument.  Court DENIES State's motion for joinder re: pending drug cases.  Court DENIES Attorney Kovac's motion for severance.  Matter remains in trial posture.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Matter is called on the record.  Court orders motion hearing adjourned.  Counsel on co-defendant case 15CF2143 filed SPEEDY trial demand on 11/13/15, matter scheduled for motion and jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
and Order for Substitution of Counsel.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Farina-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-defendants: Donnell Johnson and Derrell Taylor; Rayford J., Ricardo F ( 4/28/79); Ricardo F (6/14/57); Konta S; Anthony B; Demelius R; Alan R; Maridza M; Kyla F.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jonathan N Portillo in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
